text.sentence: Theme of the Week: This week, we look at large deal activity by some of our high growth companies.
ServiceNow is having particularly strong success in this area, with seven.seven
FireEye and Hortonworks are also faring well here, with three.two
percent, respectively, of all customers completing deals for over dollar onemn last year.
We believe that Splunk has made progress in converting large deals with its new ELA/EAA structures.

Finally, Tableau and Qlik have a lot of runway to move up in the enterprise, and we believe that their success in the future as dollar onebn+ revenue companies could hinge on their ability to execute these deals.
Oracle reported threeQsixteen earnings with total revenue slightly below consensus, but SaaS/PaaS revenue came in ahead.
We hosted Varonis management for investor meetings in Boston this week.
We hosted Mimecast management for investor meetings in the Mid Atlantic region this week.
We believe the company represents growth at a reasonable price and gives investors exposure to several secular trends in the broader security market.
Salesforce announced Filed Service Lightning this week, a product that aims to automate the management of repair or service calls such as dispatch alerts, work order creation and wrap up reports.
Symantec announced the worldwide availability of Encryption Everywhere, a website security offering available through web hosting providers.
Apple reported signed a deal with Google Cloud Platform for some of its iCloud servicing needs.
Red Hat is set to report quarterly results after the market close on Tuesday, March twenty two.

We expect the company will report healthy top and bottom line results as it continues to benefit from a stable core RHEL business and generally strong adoption of its faster growth, emerging product offerings.
We are hosting Intuit CFO Neil Williams and VP of Investor Relations Matt Rhodes for investor meetings next week.
We will not be publishing Raimo's Roundup next week due to the Easter holiday.

PLEASE SEE ANALYST CERTIFICATION AND IMPORTANT DISCLOSURES BEGINNING ON PAGE eight.
This week, we look at large deals for some of our higher growth companies.
Large deals are an important measure of success for software companies as they signal a strategic importance of a vendor to a customer, in addition to the more obvious benefit of higher sales.
We compiled the number of million dollar deals completed in the last year for the vendors that disclose that number, and compared that to the total billings number, as well as the customer count.
We found that ServiceNow is doing quite well with large deals, finishing the year with two hundred thirty customers with ACV of dollar onemn or greater.
Taking this as their large deal number, we see that they also had the highest proportion of large deals per customer, at seventy seven per thousand customers, of any company in this analysis.
There is a logical correlation between ASPs and large deal generation, since companies whose average selling price is closer to dollar onemn are more likely to achieve dollar onemn+ deals.
With this is mind, it makes sense that ServiceNow is seeing such success with large deals.
Hortonworks has also seen strong traction with large deals, and completed twenty two dollar onemn plus deals in FYfifteen despite having only existed for five years.
Generally, large deals take time to ramp as customers increase their spend year after year, which can usually be seen in a cohort analysis.

We view this early success as a positive leading indicator for the company's future performance, especially when viewed in concert with the one hundred fifty nine percent average dollar based net expansion rate.
Although Hortonworks only has eight hundred customers, it has over twenty seven dollar onemn+ deals per customer.
Splunk has worked hard to increase its large deal count, and the work appears to be paying off.
The company introduced EAAs, and more recently unlimited ELAs, to give customers greater predictability in their Splunk costs.
Despite ASPs of only dollar fiftyk, they still achieved nine large deals per thousand customers.
We expect that Splunk will continue to see solid growth in its dollar onemn+ deal count going forward as it strengthens its large deal process.
We believe that Qlik and Tableau have lots of runway to increase their large deal count.
Those two companies have, by far, the lowest proportion of large deals, each at less than one per thousand customers.

While this makes sense given the land and expand model that usually starts with just a few licenses, we believe that the ability to grow past dollar onebn in revenue will hinge upon moving up in the enterprise and transacting million dollar standardization deals.
We know from recent conversations with Tableau that this is a major focus area for them, and we think that some tweaks to the model could unlock significant amounts of spending.

Company ServiceNow FireEye Hortonworks Splunk Tableau Qlik dollar onemn Deals two hundred thirty one hundred thirty nine twenty two one hundred two thirty five thirty one Billings one thousand two hundred one.four

MobileIron Qlik Cornerstone Mimecast Demandware Red Hat Fleetmatics ServiceNow Oracle Autodesk Citrix Splunk Microsoft Salesforce NetSuite CyberArk Palo Alto SAP FireEye Teradata Ansys CA Paycom S and P five hundred PTC Intuit VMware LogMeIn Ellie Mae Imprivata Varonis Symantec Rapidseven Fivenine Hortonworks Tableau Tangoe
Oracle reported threeQsixteen earnings with total revenue slightly below consensus, but SaaS/PaaS revenue coming in ahead.
Operating margins were essentially in line, and EPS beat due to lower than expected taxes.

Licenses did continue their double digit declines, but our main takeaway from the quarter is that the cloud revenue mechanics are finally working as expected, and the revenue is flowing through the income statement.
We hosted Varonis CEO Yaki Faitelson for investor meetings in Boston this week.
Varonis' focus on data governance and security seems to be resonating well with customers who are increasingly looking at the growing threat of maliciously acting insiders.
It seems that this can help to drive greater sales velocity, which should help overall numbers.

We hosted meetings with management, and we learned two incremental things: the TTP product can double security revenue per customer, which we estimate could be a dollar forty sixtyM revenue opportunity inside the customer base alone, and competitor McAfee is end oflifing their competing email product, which we think MIME will benefit from, supporting the ~twenty percent revenue growth we are forecasting through FYeighteen.

Fundamentally, we think MIME represents growth at a reasonable price and gives investors exposure to the secular trend of email and its related security, archiving, and continuity functions moving to the cloud.
According to an article by CRN, Apple has signed a deal with Google Cloud Platform for some of its iCloud servicing needs.

The article claims that Apple is spending between dollar four hundred dollar six hundred million annually on Google Cloud Platform, or approximately half of the dollar one billion that the company reportedly spend with AWS.

It isn't clear in just what capacity Apple is using the company's services, but this report comes on the heels of the news from a few weeks ago where long time AWS client Spotify signed up to use GCP's data analytics tools.
Salesforce announced Filed Service Lightning this week, a product which aims to automate the management of repair or service calls such as dispatch alerts, work order creation and wrap up reports.
The company reportedly built the solution on top of its Service Cloud offering, but licensed components like scheduling and optimization from ClickSoftware.
Interestingly, the company released the product for general release without a pilot or beta phase, which is considered unusual in the software market.
Symantec announced the worldwide availability of Encryption Everywhere, a website security offering available through web hosting providers.

According to the company hosting providers will be able to offer customers a number of options, including basic website encryption included as part of a hosted service, and a number of premium security packages with increasingly stronger levels of website validation, protection, and trust seals.
Red Hat is set to report quarterly results after the market close on Tuesday, March twenty twond.

We expect that the company will report healthy top and bottom line results as it continues to benefit from a stable core RHEL business and generally strong adoption of its faster growth, emerging product offerings.

Results from our most recent VAR survey also came back slightly more bullish than last quarter; reseller commentary regarding new product adoption trends were particularly positive, which bodes well for the long term investment thesis, in our view.
We are hosting Intuit CFO Neil Williams and VP of Investor Relations Matt Rhodes for investor meetings next week.

The Investment Bank's Research Department produces various types of research including, but not limited to, fundamental analysis, equity linked analysis, quantitative analysis, and trade ideas.

Recommendations contained in one type of research product may differ from recommendations contained in other types of research, whether as a result of differing time horizons, methodologies, or otherwise.
Risk Disclosure Master limited partnerships are pass through entities structured as publicly listed partnerships.
For tax purposes, distributions to MLP unit holders may be treated as a return of principal.
Investors should consult their own tax advisors before investing in MLP units.

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.

Guide to the Barclays Research Price Target: Each analyst has a single price target on the stocks that they cover.
The price target represents that analyst's expectation of where the stock will trade in the next twelve months.
Upside/downside scenarios, where provided, represent potential upside/potential downside to each analyst's price target over the same twelve month period.
Top Picks: Barclays Equity Research's Top Picks represent the single best alpha generating investment idea within each industry, taken from among the Overweight rated stocks within that industry.
Barclays Equity Research publishes global and regional Top Picks reports every quarter and analysts may also publish intra quarter changes to their Top Picks, as necessary.
While analysts may highlight other Overweight rated stocks in their published research in addition to their Top Pick, there can only be one Top Pick for each industry.
To view the current list of Top Picks, go to the Top Picks page on Barclays Live .
To see a list of companies that comprise a particular industry coverage universe, please go to http://publicresearch.barclays
